definition: to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head

sentences.english: Half the sky burns red, pressing heavily down upon the bald head of the sun.
sentences.chinese: 半邊天燒紅了，重甸甸地壓在夕陽的光頭上。

sentences.english: Another red-hot iron quenched with wine, this wine notes the medicine.
sentences.chinese: 另以鐵器燒紅淬酒，將此酒調藥服。

sentences.english: Imagine what you'd do with a hot piece of coal in your hand.
sentences.chinese: 想像一下如果在你手心放下一塊燒紅的熱炭會怎麼辦？

sentences.english: Flame burnt with flamboyant reddens half of the sky.
sentences.chinese: 鳳凰木燃起的火焰，燒紅了半壁天空。

sentences.english: The hanging on by sunset red sky, a riot of colours, particularly beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 晚霞掛在被夕陽燒紅的天邊，五彩繽紛，分外美麗。

sentences.english: The blacksmith hammered a horseshoe from the red-hot metal.
sentences.chinese: 鐵匠用一塊燒紅的金屬敲製成一個馬掌。

sentences.english: Pulling out the nerves with red-hot pincers requires more coolness than knocking on the head.
sentences.chinese: 用燒紅的鉗子拔神經總比敲打腦袋需要更多的冷靜。

sentences.english: Imagine what you’d do with a hot piece of coal in your hand.
sentences.chinese: 想像一下如果在你手心放下一塊燒紅的熱炭會怎麼辦？
